lead_paragraph: Kurt Busch’s lap of 182.039 miles an hour was the fastest of yesterday’s practice for the Allstate 400 at the Brickyard, the Nextel Cup race to be run tomorrow. Busch provided hope for the Penske Racing South team, which has a rich tradition at the Indianapolis Motor Speedway but has never won the Brickyard. Roger Penske, the team owner, has won a record 14 Indy 500’s, including this year’s, won by Sam Hornish Jr.
